TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant lives in Kursk . She is the mother of PERSON , born in DATE and deceased in DATE while serving his prison sentence .

CARDINAL . In DATE PERSON wife received a letter from him . His distorted handwriting , repetitive use of words and confused language made her suspect that he was unwell .

She contended that this had not happened in the previous detention facility and had only started after her son 's transfer to correctional colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL . CARDINAL . From DATE to CARDINAL September CARDINAL Yevgeniy Geppa was transferred to the hospital of ORG in Kursk for examination and treatment . CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and PERSON wife visited him in the colony for the last time . CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote to ORG complaining that her son was being ill - treated at the colony . She complained about the beatings , the deterioration of his health and the lack of medical assistance . She requested that he be given a medical examination to identify the cause of his headaches , stomach and chest pains , and deteriorating eyesight . It informed the applicant that PERSON medical file at the colony contained records on his past organic brain lesion of complex origin ( owing to a traumatic brain injury and drug abuse ) , with emotional instability and compensatory behaviour , and epileptic syndrome ; he was also diagnosed with chronic pyelonephritis of his only kidney at the stage of remission . CARDINAL . On DATE Yevgeniy Geppa was taken to the psychiatric hospital of GPE . On the way a stop was made at DATE , where he asked to see a doctor . The medical examination revealed several symptoms of medium severity , such as a “ confused state of consciousness ” . After he had been given medication his condition improved , and he was sent on to GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE Yevgeniy Geppa arrived at the psychiatric hospital of GPE . The medical examination conducted on his arrival established that his condition was serious , he was unable to walk by himself , was pale and his extremities were cold . He could communicate with the doctor , but quickly became exhausted . Symptomatic treatment began immediately and further examinations were ordered .
CARDINAL . On DATE Yevgeniy Geppa had a general blood test . On DATE he had a chest x - ray and an electrocardiogram . On DATE he had an HIV test , which was negative .

CARDINAL . On DATE Yevgeniy Geppa underwent an x - ray brain scan that revealed hypertension . On DATE an electroencephalogram was performed , and it was concluded that there was probably a pathological formation in the left hemisphere . He also had a stomach x - ray on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE he had a general ultrasound abdominal scan that revealed some changes in the liver and pancreas . On DATE he was seen by an infection specialist , who did not find any infection .

CARDINAL . On DATE he was seen by a neurologist who ordered a brain ORG scan , which was performed on DATE and confirmed the presence of a formation in the left hemisphere . It was followed by a consultation with a neurosurgeon , who advised against surgery . On DATE an oncologist diagnosed PERSON with a brain tumour and oedema of the brain .
CARDINAL . On DATE Yevgeniy Geppa died .
CARDINAL . On DATE an autopsy , including a histological study , was conducted and established that PERSON death was caused by a brain tumour ( glioblastoma multiforme ) .

CARDINAL . Following Yevgeniy Geppa 's death ORG conducted an inquiry in order to decide whether there were grounds for a criminal investigation . On DATE it decided that no criminal investigation was necessary . The decision referred to the autopsy report , the medical file , and the statements of the hospital director and detainee PERSON , who was employed at the hospital .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG about the beatings to which her son had allegedly been subjected in the colony and alleged that there had been a negligent failure to provide him with medical assistance ; she also alleged that his transfer to the psychiatric hospital had been delayed without justification .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office decided that there were no grounds to open a criminal investigation into PERSON death . The prosecutor 's office had questioned the colony officials and inmates , who made the following statements :

– the head officer of unit no . CARDINAL where Yevgeniy Geppa was held stated that he had not received any complaints that physical force had been applied to Mr Geppa and had not seen any injuries on him ;

– inmate PERSON stated that upon his arrival at the colony PERSON had had certain health complaints , in particular he had mentioned that he was suffering from epilepsy ; he had not seen any injuries on him and had not heard any complaints about the use of force against him ;

– inmate PERSON . stated that his sleeping place in the dormitory had been next to PERSON and that he had not seen any injuries on him or heard any complaints about the use of force against him ;

– an officer of the visits and parcels section , PERSON , stated that on CARDINAL August CARDINAL PERSON had been visited by his wife and mother and that TIME into the visit he had had an epileptic fit and had been taken to the medical unit ; PERSON mother had not mentioned seeing any injuries on him ;

– an officer of the visits and parcels section , PERSON . , stated that on DATE he had searched PERSON before the visit , though without removing his clothes , and had not seen any injuries on him ; following an epileptic fit during the visit PERSON had been taken to the medical unit ; his mother had not mentioned seeing any injuries on him ;

– an officer of the medical unit , PERSON , stated that on CARDINAL DATE he had attended to PERSON after he had fainted during the visit ; when examined , PERSON had been conscious ; he had diagnosed him with epileptic syndrome and given him an injection of seduxen ; he had had a bruise on his knee ; no other injuries had been revealed ;

– the head of the medical unit stated that Yevgeniy Geppa had been registered with the colony medical unit as suffering from a psychiatric disorder , namely , “ past organic brain lesion of complex origin ” ( owing to a traumatic brain injury and drug abuse ) , with emotional instability and compensatory behaviour , and epileptic syndrome . From DATE to DATE he had been transferred to the hospital of ORG for examination and treatment ; the above diagnosis had been confirmed and in addition to that he had been diagnosed with chronic pyelonephritis of his only kidney at the stage of remission . It had been recommended that he be placed in the psychiatric hospital of GPE . In the colony PERSON had been provided with adequate medical care ; on DATE he had been transferred , with his consent , to the psychiatric hospital of GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant challenged the decision of DATE in court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Kursk found that the inquiry conducted by the prosecutor 's office into PERSON death had been insufficient . It referred in particular to the failure to verify the allegations of ill - treatment and indicated that it was necessary to establish the origin of the head injury and the brain tumour which caused his death . The court granted the applicant 's request and ordered the prosecutor 's office to carry out the inquiry in accordance with law . The prosecutor 's office appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG dated DATE . Following this decision the prosecutor 's office requested ORG to send PERSON medical file and the autopsy report to it .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the prosecutor 's office to grant her victim status in the criminal proceedings concerning her son 's death . She also requested access to documents from his medical file .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office quashed its decision of CARDINAL DATE refusing to open a criminal investigation and an additional inquiry was ordered . The applicant was informed of the decision ; she was also informed that there were no grounds to grant her victim status .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office decided to refuse to institute criminal proceedings concerning PERSON death . It stated that an additional inquiry had been carried out , which had included an examination of the medical file and questioning of the psychiatrists of the colony and of the hospital of ORG . It was established that the cause of death , the brain tumour , was consistent with the earlier diagnosis indicated in the colony medical file . It was also noted that PERSON had sustained a head injury in DATE and in the past he had abused alcohol , psychotropic substances and home - brewed narcotics ; he had also been diagnosed with epilepsy . It was therefore concluded that there were no grounds to believe that the colony staff had committed a crime against PERSON .
CARDINAL . The applicant challenged the decision of CARDINAL DATE in court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the decision dispensing with criminal proceedings unlawful . It found that the investigation file was incomplete and the prosecutor 's conclusions contradictory , in particular with reference to the failure to verify the origin of the head injury and the brain tumour , as well as PERSON state of health and the adequacy of his medical treatment prior to his transfer to the psychiatric hospital . The prosecutor 's office appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office sent a number of official inquiries to medical institutions . It asked ORG if PERSON had been under their supervision in the past ; it requested the details of his treatment for his head injury in DATE from ORG and ORG . Finally , it requested the director of the specialist oncology clinic to explain the origin , the development pattern , methods of diagnosing and treatment of the brain tumour with which PERSON had been diagnosed and the recovery rate for the disease . The latter enquiry does not appear to have been answered .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld , in substance , the decision of ORG dated DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office quashed its decision of CARDINAL DATE refusing to open the criminal investigation and an additional inquiry was ordered . The applicant was informed about the decision and provided with a copy thereof .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the administrative officer of the hospital of ORG in Kursk wrote an explanatory note for the investigation file . He stated that during his in - patient treatment at the hospital PERSON had showed no symptoms of formation of a brain tumour . Early signs of the tumour could have only been detected by a GPE scan , which had not been possible in the hospital for the lack of the requisite equipment . Moreover , there had been no apparent reason to order a GPE scan .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office decided to refuse to institute criminal proceedings concerning PERSON death . It referred to the medical records dated DATE relating to his head injury and concluded that it had predated his imprisonment . It further stated that the medical equipment available at the institutions and medical centres of the penitentiary system could not be used to diagnose the early stages of a brain tumour or to assess the necessity of a GPE scan . The scan was recommended on DATE , after the examination at the psychiatric hospital , and carried out on DATE , DATE before PERSON death . It was therefore concluded that there had been no grounds to believe that the colony staff had caused PERSON injuries or had been negligent in deciding to transfer him to the psychiatric hospital for examination . The applicant was informed about the decision and provided with a copy thereof .
CARDINAL . The applicant challenged the decision of DATE in court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the decision dispensing with criminal proceedings unlawful . It found that the inquiry had failed to establish a link between the head injury sustained by PERSON in DATE and his death in DATE and had also failed to substantiate the conclusion that the medical care received by PERSON had been appropriate for his condition . The court indicated that the above defects could only be remedied by a proper investigation and criminal proceedings and therefore it had been mandatory to open a criminal file . The court also pointed out that the procedural law did not allow a DATE preliminary inquiry to be conducted more than once .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office quashed its decision of CARDINAL DATE refusing to open a criminal investigation and an additional inquiry was ordered . The applicant was informed about the decision and provided with a copy thereof .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of Kursk requested the prosecutor 's office of GPE to provide it with PERSON medical file from the psychiatric hospital of GPE and the autopsy report .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office decided to refuse to institute criminal proceedings concerning PERSON death . It essentially reiterated the contents of the decision of DATE , adding that the prosecutor 's office of GPE had not replied to the request of DATE , hence there was no new information that would allow the allegations of medical negligence to be confirmed . The applicant was informed about the decision and provided with a copy thereof .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE forwarded the requested documents to the prosecutor 's office of Kursk .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office quashed its decision of CARDINAL DATE refusing to open a criminal investigation and an additional inquiry was ordered . The applicant was informed about the decision and provided with a copy thereof . On DATE the term for additional inquiry was extended from DATE in order to obtain the medical expert opinion .

DATE . On DATE the prosecutor 's office requested the director of ORG to explain the origin of , the possible cause of and methods of diagnosing the brain tumour found in PERSON . The director was asked whether the tumour could have been caused by Mr Geppa 's head injury , whether it was treatable and whether Mr PERSON 's death could have been avoided if timely medical treatment had been provided .
CARDINAL . On DATE the clinic director and the head of the clinic 's neurosurgery department replied as follows :
“ CARDINAL . The cause of cancerous brain tumours ( glioblastoma multiforme ) is currently unknown .
CARDINAL . NORP Neither scientific research data nor our experience confirms any link between brain injuries and [ tumours ] .
CARDINAL . Early signs of a brain tumour formation are general brain and localised neurological symptoms and changes in the fundus of the eye .
CARDINAL . Glioblastoma multiforme is one of the most malignant forms of brain tumour with the period between its formation and death varying DATE depending on its location .
CARDINAL . The prognosis of this disease , regardless of the promptness of its diagnosis and specialist treatment , is extremely negative , the disease not being susceptible to treatment . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office decided to refuse to institute criminal proceedings concerning PERSON death . In addition to the medical documents and witness statements relied on in the previous decisions , it referred to the medical opinion of DATE given by the ORG director . It concluded that there had been no evidence of violence or medical negligence having contributed to his death . The applicant was informed about the decision and provided with a copy thereof . She appealed against this decision in court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the decision dispensing with criminal proceedings unlawful . It found that the inquiry had failed to address the reasons for the diagnosis having been established so late despite PERSON frequent examination and treatment ; the court could not rule out that there had been an unjustified delay in providing him with specialised medical care and pointed out that the negative prognosis did not absolve the penitentiary and medical staff from taking all the necessary steps in order to diagnose and treat him . The prosecutor 's office appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE on the grounds that it had failed to specify the shortcomings in the investigation that the prosecutor 's office had to remedy . The case was remitted to the same court for a fresh examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found the decision dispensing with criminal proceedings lawful and justified . Addressing the applicant 's argument that the investigators had failed to request the medical file from the psychiatric hospital of GPE , the court observed that the file had actually been obtained , that it had been attached to the investigation file and , furthermore , that it had been directly examined in the courtroom .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was given the opportunity to access PERSON medical file .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW of GPE provides as follows :

“ A detainee who has acquired a serious illness [ other than psychiatric ] which prevents him from serving his sentence may lodge a request with a court for [ early ] release ... [ This request ] must be lodged by the detainee through the administration of the penitentiary institution ... The said request must be accompanied by the expert opinion of a medical commission or a socio - medical expert institution and the detainee 's prison record . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the Government of GPE adopted Decree no . DATE establishing a list of diseases incompatible with serving a prison sentence . That list included malignant tumours ( cancer ) in stage IV according to ORG classification ( point CARDINAL of the decree ) and kidney diseases in the terminal phase with chronic renal failure .
